metadata.title: CVE-2016-10937 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
IMAPFilter through 2.6.12 does not validate the hostname in an SSL certificate. It was discovered that IMAPFilter incorrectly validated SSL certificates. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to intercept secure communications.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-10937` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imapfilter - 1:2.6.13-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imapfilter package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.6.13-1').
